summary: This bill, the Erie Canal Bicentennial Commemorative Coin Act, mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins to recognize the 200th anniversary of the Erie Canal. The bill specifies the coin denominations ($5 gold, $1 silver, and half-dollar clad), design requirements (emblematic of the Erie Canal), issuance period, and sale prices including surcharges. Surcharges from coin sales will be directed to the Erie Canalway Heritage Fund, Inc., for preservation, recreation, and educational programs. The bill also includes financial assurances to prevent net costs to the government. Coin design will be selected in consultation with relevant bodies.
